topic.title: HPE Helion Development Platform 2.0: ALS Command Reference: Routes

ul.li: helion delete-route: Delete the named route.
helion routes: List all routes or routes available in the specified space.

section.title: Syntax
section.p: For more information, use the helion help or helion help [command] commands.

row.entry: --all
Delete all routes which are not used by any application (--unused) across all domains. Cannot be used together with route names.
--organization

The name of the organization to use as context. Defaults to the current organization. A current organization is automatically set if there is none, either by taking the one organization the user has, or asking the user to choose among the possibilities. Cannot be used together with --all.
--space

The name of the space to use as context. Defaults to the current space. A current space is automatically set if there is none, either by taking the one space the user has, or asking the user to choose among the possibilities.
--target
The once-off target to use for the current operation.
--token
The once-off authentication token to use for the current operation.
--token-file
Path to an existing and readable file containing the targets and authorization tokens.
--unused
Delete all routes which are not used by any application. Cannot be used together with route names.

section.title: helion routes
section.p: List all available routes or all routes in the specified space.

row.entry: --all
Query information about all domains. Cannot be used together with a space.
--organization

The name of the organization to use as context. Defaults to the current organization. A current organization is automatically set if there is none, either by taking the one organization the user has, or asking the user to choose among the possibilities. Cannot be used together with --all.
--space

The name of the space to use as context. Defaults to the current space. A current space is automatically set if there is none, either by taking the one space the user has, or asking the user to choose among the possibilities.
--target
The once-off target to use for the current operation.
--token
The once-off authentication token to use for the current operation.
--token-file
Path to an existing and readable file containing the targets and authorization tokens.
--unused
Filter output to show only the routes which are not used by any application.
